title: Start-ups set out to make coffee more sustainable - Financial Times
summary: The coffee industry is facing a growing waste problem, with billions of cups and grounds being discarded each year.  Entrepreneurs are developing innovative ways to use coffee byproducts, transforming coffee husks into building materials, spent grounds into reusable cups, and coffee pulp into ethanol. This shift towards circularity is being driven by environmental concerns and a desire to create sustainable and profitable businesses.
product_or_process: Building boards made from coffee husks

title: ESGL Holdings Limited (NASDAQ: ESGL) Announces Multi-Year Contract Renewal with Singapore Refining Company ... - GlobeNewswire
summary: Environmental Solutions Group Holdings Limited (ESGL) has renewed a multi-year contract with Singapore Refining Company Private Limited (SRC) for used catalyst waste disposal services. ESGL will provide these services through December 31, 2025, showcasing their commitment to circular economy solutions in the petrochemical industry.

title: Reboxed® secures £1.6 million Seed investment led by ACF Investors - UK Tech Investment News
summary: Reboxed®, a sustainable tech startup, secured £1.6 million in seed funding to scale its recommerce platform that helps businesses and consumers buy and sell refurbished electronics. The company aims to reduce e-waste and provide a more sustainable alternative to new tech purchases, offering premium refurbished devices and branded solutions for retailers. Reboxed® is driven by a mission to rehome 100 million devices by 2030, contributing to a more circular economy.
